customLabels.name: Relationship_Explanation_Connector

customLabels.label: Auto-Create settings let you define when a Relationship record is automatically created between a Contact and a Campaign Member, based on a custom lookup field on one of the two objects. For example, a 'Referral' lookup from Campaign Member to Contact could create a 'Referrer' and 'Referee' Relationship between the two Contacts. (Note that this feature is not available for Leads or Campaign Member objects that reference Leads.)
customLabels.name: RelationshipsAutoDescription

customLabels.label: These settings allow you to configure reciprocal relationships, or the "matching" relationship between two Contacts. For example, since a father is related to his son, there should be an additional record showing the son related back to his father. You can specify the Type value for the Name, and what the reciprocal value should be based on the gender of the connecting Contact. You can define male, female, and neutral values for each reciprocal setting..
customLabels.name: RelationshipsLookupDescription

customLabels.label: The Filter Field value names a duplicate of a product field. Specify a non-duplicate field. Otherwise, we filter using the value in the product field. For example, if the duplicate field is Deceased__c, enter Deceased__c{0} as the Filter Field value.

customLabels.label: Verify the reciprocal setting for {0} ({1}) specified in EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab. If {0} ({1}) is correct for Male, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Female value to a valid, active picklist value.
customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelMaleInactiveFix

customLabels.label: In EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab, change the corresponding reciprocal setting's Male value to a valid, active picklist value.
customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelMaleNotFoundFix

customLabels.label: Reciprocal Setting's Male Value
customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelMaleTitle

customLabels.label: Verify the reciprocal setting for {0} ({1}) specified in EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.
customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameInactiveFix

customLabels.label: In EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab, change the corresponding reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.label: Verify the reciprocal setting for {0} ({1}) specified in EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.
customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameNotUniqueDesc

customLabels.label: In EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab, look for multiple rows specifying {0} ({1}) in the Name column. Edit those reciprocal settings so that this Name value appears in only one reciprocal setting row.

customLabels.label: For Higher Education institutions, we recommend the "Administrative" Account model. For K-12 schools, we recommend the "Household" Account model.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAccountModel

customLabels.label: Record types of Accounts that are automatically deleted if all their associated Contacts have been deleted.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAccoutsDeletedIfChildContactsDeleted

customLabels.label: The Account record types that support multiple address management.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAddressAccRecType

customLabels.label: The Account record type used for Administrative Accounts. This setting affects management of address records and the naming format of Administrative Accounts.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAdminRecType

customLabels.label: If selected, the Program Enrolment End Date is copied to the End Date on new Affiliation records. Otherwise, the Affiliation End Date is left blank.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCopyProgramEnrollmentEndDate

customLabels.label: If selected, the Program Enrolment Start Date is copied to the Start Date on new Affiliation records. Otherwise, the Affiliation Start Date is left blank.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCopyProgramEnrollmentStartDate

customLabels.label: Affiliations Created with Program Enrolments
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCreateFromProgramEnrollmentHeader

customLabels.label: When a Program Enrolment record is created without an existing Affiliation, create an Affiliation record with the values specified below.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCreateFromProgramEnrollmentInfo

customLabels.label: The Status set on the Affiliation related to a deleted Program Enrolment.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflDeleteProgramEnrollment

customLabels.label: Program Enrolment Deletions
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflDeleteProgramEnrollmentHeader

customLabels.label: Specify below how you want Affiliation records for deleted Program Enrolments to be handled. The related Affiliation record can either be deleted, or have its Status updated.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflDeleteProgramEnrollmentInfo

customLabels.label: If selected, set the new Affiliation's role to the value defined in Role for Created Affiliations. Otherwise, leave the Affiliation's role blank.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflProgEnrollSetRole

customLabels.label: The role set on the Affiliation created with a Program Enrolment.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflProgEnrollSetRoleValue

customLabels.label: The status set on the Affiliation created with a Program Enrolment.
customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflProgEnrollSetStatusValue

customLabels.label: Select this option to enable multiple address management for Contacts.
customLabels.name: stgHelpContactAddrs

customLabels.label: Do not require Contacts to have a Preferred Email.
customLabels.name: stgHelpContactPreferredEmail

customLabels.label: Do not require Contacts to have a Preferred Phone.
customLabels.name: stgHelpContactPreferredPhone

customLabels.label: Sync the Preferred Phone field to the Contact's standard Phone field and validate that the value in Preferred Phone exists and has a value.
customLabels.name: stgHelpContactPreferredPhoneSync

customLabels.label: The process was queued successfully. An email will be sent at the completion of the job.
customLabels.name: stgHelpCopyQueuedEmailSent

customLabels.label: The Course Connections Backfill should be used only when enabling Course Connections for the first time and only in orgs where Course Offerings and Course Connections (Enrolments) existed prior to enabling the Course Connections feature. The Backfill converts all Contacts that were listed as faculty on a Course Connection (Enrolment) or Course Offering to the Default Faculty Record Type. The Backfill then converts the Contacts on the remaining Course Connections (Enrolments) to the Default Active Student Record Type.
customLabels.name: stgHelpCourseConnBackfillDescription

customLabels.label: In EDA 1.30, the Extended Description field was added to accommodate longer course descriptions.
customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigration

customLabels.label: This utility copies values from the Course Description field to the Extended Description field. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.
customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigrationCopiesValues

customLabels.label: If a Course already has a value for Extended Description, we don't overwrite it.
customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigrationDontOverwrite

customLabels.label: After the process is complete, remember to update page layouts and other areas of the application that refer to the Description fields.
customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigrationUpdatePageLayouts

customLabels.label: The Fluency value automatically set on newly created Contact Language records when users set the Primary Language lookup field on a Contact.
customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultContactLanguageFluency

customLabels.label: The default record type when creating Course Connections for a faculty member.
customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultFacultyType

customLabels.label: The default record type when creating Course Connections for active students.
customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultStudentType

customLabels.label: You must enable Course Connections before running the Course Connections Backfill.
customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableCourseConnBeforeBackfill

customLabels.label: You must enable Course Connections before editing record types.
customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableCourseConnBeforeRecordTypes

customLabels.label: Course Connection records connect a Contact with a Course Offering. Enabling this feature allows users to choose the type of Contact (Faculty or Student) to create the Course Connection for. When you enable this feature, you also need to set the Default Active Student Record Type and Default Faculty Record Type, below. If you're enabling this feature for the first time, we highly recommend you run the Course Connections Backfill.
customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableCourseConnections

customLabels.label: For existing Contacts who haven't specified a Preferred Email or Preferred Phone, the cleanup ensures that one of the Contact's standard or custom email addresses or phone numbers are set as the preferred value.
customLabels.name: stgHelpEnsureExistContactPreferEmail

customLabels.label: Select to disable the product's error handling framework.
customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorDisable

customLabels.label: If selected, notifications are posted for product-generated errors.
customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorNotifyOn

customLabels.label: Specify who should receive email error notifications. Valid values are 'All Sys Admins', the ID of a user in your org, or the ID of a Chatter group. You can enter only one value.
customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorNotifyTo

customLabels.label: Use the Ethnicity and Race Backfill only if your org used the Ethnicity field before the Race field was added and values were removed from the Ethnicity field as of EDA version 1.28. If the value in the Contact's Ethnicity field does not equal “Not Hispanic or Latino” or “Hispanic or Latino,” the Backfill copies the value to the Race field. Both standard picklist values and any custom values that you may have added are eligible to be copied.
customLabels.name: stgHelpEthnicityRaceBackfill

customLabels.label: Enables Address management for Administrative and Household Accounts when selected.
customLabels.name: stgHelpHouseAdmAccountAddressMgmt

customLabels.label: The Account record type used for Household Accounts. This setting affects management of Address records and the naming format of Household Accounts.
customLabels.name: stgHelpHouseholdRecType

customLabels.label: If your org previously added custom picklist values to the Ethnicity field that you want to be available in the Race field, copy those custom picklist values to the Race field.
customLabels.name: stgHelpIfCustomValuesEthnicityCopyRace

customLabels.label: When selected, Plan Requirements can specify either a Program Plan or a parent Plan Requirement, but not both. If you specify both a Program Plan and a parent Plan Requirement, an error message will prevent you from saving until only one is selected.
customLabels.name: stgHelpNestedPlanRequirementPP

customLabels.label: Enables Address management for Organisational Accounts when selected.
customLabels.name: stgHelpOrgAccountAddressMgmt

customLabels.label: Auto-created Relationships are deduplicated by default to prevent duplicate Relationship records from being created between two Contacts. Select "Allow Auto-Created Duplicate Relations" to disable this behaviour and allow multiple Relationships of the same type between two Contacts.
customLabels.name: stgHelpRelAutoCreatedDup

customLabels.label: The method used to populate the type field when creating a Reciprocal Relationship. "List Setting" uses the custom settings defined on the Reciprocal Relationships tab with male, female, and neutral values. "Value Inversion" inverts the type on the original Relationship record where appropriate. For example, if the originating Relationship is Parent-Child, the Reciprocal Relationship will be Child-Parent.
customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalMethod

customLabels.label: Remove all picklist values from the Ethnicity field except for "Hispanic or Latino" and "Not Hispanic or Latino." We recommend that you replace each removed value with one of the remaining valid values, rather than deleting them outright from existing records. As of EDA version 1.28, the only valid Ethnicity values are "Not Hispanic or Latino" and "Hispanic or Latino."
customLabels.name: stgHelpRemoveAllPicklistValuesEthnicityExceptHispanicOrLatino

customLabels.label: Treats changes to single Contact or Account address fields as updates to the existing address (i.e., no new Address object is created). Also causes white space and case changes to be treated as updates.
customLabels.name: stgHelpSimpleAddrChangeIsUpdate

customLabels.label: When selected, errors are stored in a custom Error object. You can create a tab for the Errors object to view a list of all stored errors.
customLabels.name: stgHelpStoreErrorsOn

customLabels.label: If you had reports or formula fields that referenced the previous values in the Ethnicity field, update them.
customLabels.name: stgHelpUpdateReportIfDependenciesEthnicity

customLabels.label: Validate Program Plan for Nested Plan Requirements
customLabels.name: stgNestedPlanRequirementPP

customLabels.label: Warning: Clicking this button renames ALL existing Administrative Account records to the format specified in Administrative Account Name Format. Read the product documentation to be sure that you understand the consequences of this irreversible change. Before you proceed, disable any automation or processes that reference Administrative Accounts (for example, workflow rules). After the refresh is complete, you can re-enable them.
customLabels.name: stgRefreshAdminAcctNameDesc

customLabels.label: Refresh All Administrative Account Names
customLabels.name: stgRefreshAdminAcctNameTitle

customLabels.label: Warning: Clicking this button renames ALL existing Household Account records to the format specified in Household Account Name Format. This action enables the Automatically Rename Household Accounts setting, even if previously unselected. Read the product documentation to be sure that you understand the consequences of this irreversible change. Before you proceed, disable any automation or processes that reference Household Accounts (for example, workflow rules). After the refresh is complete, you can re-enable them.
customLabels.name: stgRefreshHHAcctNameDesc

customLabels.label: Refresh All Household Account Names
customLabels.name: stgRefreshHHAcctNameTitle
